wiki.content: According to the Truly Madly Deeply Songfacts, this was originally an older Savage Garden song called "Magical Kisses," which they reworked to become "Truly Madly Deeply." It was included on the band's first-ever demo cassette that they shopped to labels in 1994. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: According to the Truly Madly Deeply Songfacts, this was originally an older Savage Garden song called "Magical Kisses," which they reworked to become "Truly Madly Deeply." It was included on the band's first-ever demo cassette that they shopped to labels in 1994.

track.name: Truly Madly Deeply
comments: Great song ♥
suber suber

I'm pretty sure this was about his wife. They were still married at the time he wrote it and his career was taking off. He was always gay but I believe they had a unique love that surpassed friendship and he was missing her.
His voice.... <3 beautiful.
but seriously... ;-;
them feels </3
Favorite song by them
schon lange her, aber immer noch schön!
TT_TT
It feels like I'm 13 years old again. Life is as imminent as a tunnel approaching me.
We did, one of our songs, until he passed.  My love for this song will keep him with me, he will always be in my heart. I love this song and people I am close to.  <3
Memories.
So many feels from this song. Goddamnit, I miss the 90's and Savage Garden :`( I love these songs and yet everytime I listen to them, I feel like shit because I miss the times back then.
First heard this in 6th grade.  Every time I hear this song it brings me back to my first "love" in 6th grade.  Such wonderful memories instigated by an equally beautiful song!
I agree with DaylightAgain, this song always calmed me (though, I thought it was a girl singing when I was little >___>).
When I was little I would listen to this while I fell asleep, haha. This song just makes me so calm...
i'll be your dream...i'll be your wish...i'll be your fanatasy...
@kick_push23: What does it matter? It's a lovely song either way.
Is he singing about a girl or a guy?
